results.title: Ian's case
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Improving Performance”.
Ian works in an art department. His work has become sloppy, he makes long personal phone calls, he drinks and he is constantly late or off work. His supervisor, Hugo, has spoken to him twice previously and now adopts the hard approach. Peter Quarry then assumes the role of supervisor and uses the 3 step approach.

results.title: Ian's case (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Improving Performance”.
Peter Quarry introduces a 3 step process for discussing poor work performance with staff. Discusses real life examples of common mistakes together with the correct way to counsel staff.

results.title: Heather's case
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Improving Performance”.
The youngest clerical worker in a project team is angry about staff who are inconsiderate, messy and who avoid her whilst her colleagues have complained to the new supervisor about her being aggressive. The supervisor attempts to resolve the problem and then Peter Quarry assumes the role of supervisor and uses the 3 step approach.

results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Sandra Richardson, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A series of programs centred on the “self image” of primary school-aged children. Useful for child and adolescent counsellors and child development educators.

results.title: Dean and Donna
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Sandra Richardson, Martyn Down, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “I myself”.
Part of a series designed to facilitate discussion of various issues and themes related to social education, human relations and personal development and designed for use with primary-school and lower secondary school children in the 8 to 14 year age range. This part looks at Donna and Dean who are learning to adjust to different ‘blended family’ situations. Donna and her natural brother Scott have joined older brothers and sisters. Donna is now no longer the eldest. Dean lives with his father and new step-mother. They have recently had a baby. Explores the feelings they express while they are seeking to make the necessary readjustments.

results.title: Tracey and Trevor
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Sandra Richardson, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “I myself”
Tracey and Trevor discuss how they feel about being a girl and a boy. They reveal their own values and comment on the expectations and prejudices of others, including their friends family and society. The film looks at conflicts faced by children who do not wish to conform to commonly-held sex-role stereotypes.

results.title: Stephanie
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Sandra Richardson, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “I myself”.
The film gives insights into Stephanie’s strategy for coping with a physical handicap. Her attitude towards others with intellectual and physical handicaps is revealed in her interactions with her sister at home and with handicapped children who visit her school.
